greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle P, read by rows, that satisfies [P^4](n,k) = P(n+1,k+1) for n>=k>=0, also [P^(4*m)](n,k) = [P^m](n+1,k+1) for all m, where [P^m](n,k) denotes the element at row n, column k, of the matrix power m of P, with P(k,k)=1 and P(k+1,1)=P(k+1,0) for k>=0.
comment: Column 0 and column 1 are equal for n>0.
formula: Let q=4; the g.f. of column k of P^m (ignoring leading zeros) equals: 1 + Sum_{n>=1} (m*q^k)^n/n! * Product_{j=0..n-1} L(q^j*x) where L(x) satisfies: x = Sum_{n>=1} -(-1)^n/n!*Product_{j=0..n-1} L(q^j*x); L(x) equals the g.f. of column 0 of the matrix log of P (A111849).
example: Let q=4; the g.f. of column k of matrix power P^m is:
Thus the g.f. of column 0 of matrix power P^m is:
where P^4 shifts columns left and up one place:
xref: Cf. A111846 (column 0), A111847 (row sums), A111848 (matrix log), A111840 (q=3), A078536 (variant).
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Aug 23 2005
